title: New wording/effects on Ravenous/ titanic hydra.
body: So it no longer says melee only on the item.   Confirm?  Works on ranged champs?

replies.body: No, they're still melee only. That's now better conveyed in the shop however (red lines over the line if you're ranged with 'Melee Only' text), so there's no need to add to duplicate that on the tooltip as well.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Q99tEEnZ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-11-20T21:33:13.706+0000)
>
> No, they're still melee only. That's now better conveyed in the shop however (red lines over the line if you're ranged with 'Melee Only' text), so there's no need to add to duplicate that on the tooltip as well.

Wait so if you're ranged, you're not allowed to buy Hydras anymore? Does that mean melees can't buy Runaan's hurricane?
Correct.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Q99tEEnZ,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-20T22:03:55.965+0000)
>
> Correct.

But how does that work for Kayle? Does she have to activate her E to buy Runaan's Hurricane, and have it be inactive to buy hydra?
Champions like Kayle, Elise etc who have ranged and melee states can buy both ranged and melee items. They'll only get the benefits in the appropriate state though of course.

Generally I'm much more likely to respond to posts that:

* Are about a subject I've got some expertise in (I can talk usefully about champion ability changes for example, but can't offer much beyond personal opinion on server performance or skin lines).
* Are succinct and to the point. It's much, much easier to respond to a post that's got a couple of clear questions or points, than it is to respond properly to a two page long post that either covers a lot of different things or gets into a really detailed level of analysis. I do like responding to like stuff but usually only can when it's late in the evening and I've got a solid block of free time, rather than between meetings or other tasks at work ('what can I usefully respond to in 10 minutes?' being the common test). 
* Could lead to a positive conversation. Highly critical posts are fine of course (e.g. 'I'm really concerned about the changes to X champion and think it's a really bad approach for Y reasons'). Threads that start with things like 'WHAT THE **** IS WRONG WITH YOU RIOT YOU SHOULD ALL BE FIRED' though are much less likely to be a good use of posting time.
* Aren't repeating something that's already been discussed a lot recently. I realize it's pretty hard to keep track of everything that gets discussed, I do feel there's a lot less value in repeating things we've recently talked about elsewhere.
* Will be of interest to at least a moderately wide audience. 

There are almost certainly some other factors I'm forgetting, that's the first list of stuff that leaps to mind though.
Could you say your thoughts on the Current popularity of Guinsoo's Rageblade? I've been seeing it on Lulu, Ezreal, Tryndamere, Yi, and Xin Zhao. Would you say it's a healthy item right now?
Too cheap and potentially too powerful, especially in the way it's giving wave clear to champions like Ezreal. I'd imagine we'll need to make further changes to it after the upcoming price increase.
